    • Method Detail

      • readTabDelimitedColumns

        public static java.lang.Object[] readTabDelimitedColumns(java.lang.String filepath)
                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads tab delimited file and returns them as list of list, with [x] = colummn and [x][y] is value in column. Needed for reading counts file, as there the rows are the samples, as opposed to expression and genotype file where the columns are the samples. Needs to be read in memory, so minimal memory requirement is larger than the size of the counts file.
        Parameters:
        filepath - The path to a tab delimited file to read
        Returns:
        A 2D array with each array being one column from filepath except first column and a 1D array with the first column (without header)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If file at filepath can not be read

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • binaryPermutations

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> binaryPermutations(java.lang.String soFar,
                                                                       double iterations,
                                                                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> permutations)
        Create permutations of binary numbers of length iterations. E.g. if iterations == 2, would give 00, 10, 01, 11
        Parameters:
        soFar - The string that will contain the binary permutation. Should be empty when given to the function (used in the recursion)
        iterations - The length of the binary string
        permutations - List that contains all the permutations of the binary string. Should be given empty (used to save the recursion results)
        Returns:
        List of permutations of 0's and 1's of given length
